resources.string: Shoot a real object and quickly create a model
Cloud modeling can be performed only after login.
The target object is detected. Click the button to start scanning.
Please place the target object in the center of the screen

Place the object on a solid-color plane with soft lighting. It is recommended to take more than 50 shots in a circle around the object. The screen-to-body ratio of the object is as large and complete as possible.
A material can be uploaded in synchronous mode. In asynchronous mode, 1 to 10 materials can be uploaded.
Synchronous mode, supporting the upload of a single material
In asynchronous mode, 1 to 5 materials can be uploaded.
Aim at the target material and click the button to capture
Statement on 3D Rubik\'s Cube and Privacy
Help you quickly convert a real object into an exquisite 3D model; only need to take pictures or video...
What are the requirements for your device?
How to download and use the created model?
Can models and materials created by myself be commercially available?
Ensure that the objects that need to be modeled occupy the screen as much as possible
For objects that support specifications, multiple images are taken around a circle to help you quickly realize automatic generation of 3D models.
Does object modeling support object specification requirements?
For materials that support specifications, a single flat material area is collected to ensure soft lighting, clear images, no bright spots, no shadows, and no reflections.
Collects a single flat material area with soft illumination and clear images without bright spots, shadows, or reflections.
What types of materials are supported by material generation?
Huawei mobile phones and Huawei tablets EMUI 3.1 and above, non-Huawei phones and non-Huawei tablets Android 4.4 and above.
Objects need to have rich textures, non-reflective, and medium size. Typical objects include commodities (soft toys, bags, shoes), furniture (sofa), cultural relics (bronze, stone, wood), etc.
It supports concrete, marble, rock, gravel, brick, plaster, clay, metal, wood, bark, leather, fabric, paint, plastic, synthetic materials. Transparent and translucent materials are not supported.
It is recommended to take more than 50 photos, the modeling effect will be better
Copyright Â©2020-2021 3D Magic All rights reserved
Place the phone camera at an angle of zero degrees above the shoe\'s horizontal axis. The turntable turns one round.
Place the phone camera at an angle of 45 degrees above the shoe\'s horizontal axis. The turntable turns one round.
Place the phone camera at an angle of 90 degrees above the shoe\'s horizontal axis. The turntable turns half a round.
Put the shoe on its side. Place the phone camera at an angle of 0 to 15 degrees above the shoe\'s horizontal axis. The turntable turns one round.
Put the shoe on its side. Place the phone camera at an angle of 45 degrees above the shoe\'s horizontal axis. The turntable turns one round.

Hold the phone and take multiple shots of the object from different positions; or place the phone in a fixed position and put the object on a turntable, and then take multiple shots. Rotate the object fully when shooting it from each angle, such as from the top and face on. Ensure the object occupies most of the cameras view and the overlap ratio between shots is greater than 70%. You are advised to take at least 50 images.
The shooting steps are relatively complicated; and equipment such as turntables and mobile phone stabilizers are required; only horizontal screen shooting is supported
Place the phone at 0Â°. Before rotating the carousel, take two to four positive photos. Rotate the carousel once and take another 24 photos.
Place the phone at 45Â° and rotate the turntable once to take 24 pictures.
Place the mobile phone at 60Â° to 90Â° and shoot the top and shoulders of the bone-bound object. You are advised to rotate the turntable to take 24 pictures.
Place your phone directly above the object with the camera facing downward. Turn the carousel around to take 12 pictures.
The back of the object lies on the turntable. Place the mobile phone directly above the object, with the camera facing down, and rotate the turntable to take 12 pictures.
